title: IDA Pro Alternative for JavaScript?
content:
I am looking for a good "disassembler" for JavaScript, like IDA Pro but for JS. I am looking at a chrome extension, but the JavaScript is heavily obfuscated. After deobfuscating, I am left with variable and function names like "_0xa893x5". This is using jsbeautifier.org; other deobfuscators give error. This unintuitive syntax makes it more than a little different to follow the program; is there a tool like IDA for Javascript where I can graphically trace the flow of the program from function to function?
Thanks!

answers_data.content: Have a look at https://github.com/scottrogowski/code2flow for generating callgraphs.

comments.text: Is there a newer alternative? It appears this one doesnt support ecma6+

answers_data.content: I recommend using an IDE such as WebStorm or Eclipse. You will be able to rename variables and functions, navigate to definitions and find cross-references.
